title: RADS Error
body:
For 2-4 months, I have gotten a RADS error every god damn time i'm trying to launch LoL.. I get the league of legends logo, then automatically get the RADS error.. No patcher/launcher is shown.
I have tried the following thing:
- Changed DNS settings to Google's (8.8.4.4 , 8.8.8.8)
- Flushed DNS
- Added ports into my firewall
- Added game in the firewall
- Disabled firewall
- Disabled antivirus
- Run as Administrator
- Reinstalled game (several times)
- Used windows hard drive check
- Scanned for virus
- Scanned/fixed my whole PC for problems with Tweaking.com's Windows Repair
- Checked if it's my ISP (this problem occur on EVERY network.. My other pc works fine)
- Checked the "hosts" file
- And probably more..

This is a PC with Windows 7 Professional. It's a school PC, so it's part of a domain. The domain can not be the problem because my friends with similar pc's can play LoL on theirs.. This problem has not occured before..  It's really getting on my nerves, and support can't help me either.. Sent them all the files they ask me to send, and still don't know what my problem is. I can not reset at first because of the domain.. Would remove the domain and thats something I do not want to do right now..

Please send me every tip.. I'm really desperate

replies.body:
Hey cheesedoodl,

I'm sorry to hear that you're encountering connection issues to the League of Legends servers. Before we start looking at factors that may be causing these issues on the ISP end, I'd first like to confirm that the issue does not lay on your end of things. Can you try as many solutions as you can that are provided in the [**Troubleshooting Connection Issues**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) Riot Games Support article?

If those solutions don't work, let's start looking into the diagnostics and see where the issue may be originating. To do this, we'll need you to provide some information for us: 

1. Confirmation that you've tried the solutions in the Troubleshooting Connection Issues article
2. ISP that you're using
3. Region and/or State
4. Trace Route (Tracert) - If you're unsure how to do this, check out [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2)
5. When did these issues begin occurring, and how often?
6. Additional information you'd like to provide

Thank you for your time.
